required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of VGR-R01 for Patients With Bietti Crystalline Dystrophy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of VGR-R01 in Patients With Bietti Crystalline Dystrophy

brief_summary.textblock: A Multicenter, Open-Label, Non-Randomized, Uncontrolled Study of VGR-R01 in Patients with Bietti Crystalline Dystrophy.

detailed_description.textblock: VGR-R01 is a novel AAV vector carrying the human CYP4V2 coding sequence. This study is intended to evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single subretinal administration of VGR-R01. All subjects will undergo at least 52 weeks of safety observation and will be encouraged to enroll in an extension study to evaluate the long-term safety of VGR-R01 for a total of five years.

primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a product; the event will not need to have a causal relationship with the treatment.

A serious adverse event (SAE) is any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that resulted in death; life threatening; require inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity; result in congenital anomaly/birth defect.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change from Baseline in Vital Signs
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs (temperature, respiratory rate, pulse rate, systolic and diastolic blood pressure) will be obtained with participant in the seated position, after having sat calmly for at least 5 minutes. Clinical significance of vital signs will be determined at the investigator's discretion.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Clinically Laboratory Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory Tests will include hematology, coagulation, blood chemistry, urinalysis, serology, and pregnancy test, etc. If any potential changes accompanied by clinical symptoms, or results in a change of medical intervention, the findings will be considered as clinically significant based on investigator's decision.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change from Baseline in Ophthalmic Examination Findings
primary_outcome.description: Ophthalmic Examination will include BCVA, IOP, slitlamp examination, angiography and SD-OCT, etc. If any potential changes accompanied by clinical symptoms, or results in a change of medical intervention, the findings will be considered as clinically significant based on investigator's decision.

secondary_outcome.description: BCVA will be assessed for both eyes using the Early Treatment of Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) visual acuity (VA) chart. BCVA test should be performed prior to pupil dilation, and distance refraction should be carried out before BCVA is measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of Visual Field Index (%) in Visual Field (Humphery perimetry) indexes
secondary_outcome.description: The VFI can range from 100% (normal visual field) to 0% (perimetrically blind field).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of Mean Deviation (dB) in Visual Field (Humphery perimetry) indexes
secondary_outcome.description: Normal values are typically within 0dB and -2dB.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of Pattern Standard Deviation (dB) in Visual Field (Humphery perimetry) indexes
secondary_outcome.description: A typical "normal" dB reading is around 30. The numeric dB graph should be studied next. The dBs tested by the Humphrey analyzer range between 0 and 50 dB (0 is the brightest and 50 is the dimmest).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in Mobility testing scores
secondary_outcome.description: The mobility score range is between -1 (the worst functional vision) and 6 (the best).

other_outcome.measure: Patient reported outcome: Changes of NEI-VFQ-25
other_outcome.description: NEI-VFQ-25 questionnaire measures dimensions of self-reported vision-targeted health status that are most important to persons with eye disease. Total score ranges from 0-100, where a score of 0 represents the worst outcome and 100 represents the best outcome.

intervention.description: CYP4v2-coding gene delivered by AAV vector

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD will be shared with other researchers when VGR-R01 is fully approved.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD will be shared with other researchers when VGR-R01 is fully approved.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD will be shared with other researchers when VGR-R01 is fully approved.
